document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Content Standards for California Public Schools, Prekindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FD6EEF70DFE30131994268A86D17958E.description: Establish criteria to use in selecting works of art for a specific type of art exhibition.

FD6E5A10DFE30131994068A86D17958E.description: Describe tactics employed in advertising to sway the viewer's thinking and provide examples.

FD6DBEC0DFE30131993E68A86D17958E.description: Create artwork containing visual metaphors that express the traditions and myths of selected cultures.

FD6D76D0DFE30131993D68A86D17958E.description: Research how traditional characters (such as the trickster) found in a variety of cultures past and present are represented in illustrations.

FD6D2C90DFE30131993C68A86D17958E.description: Research how art was used in theatrical productions in the past and in the present.

FD6C8D40DFE30131993A68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in the Visual Arts to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD6C2120DFE30131993968A86D17958E.description: Change, edit, or revise their works of art after a critique, articulating reasons for their changes.

FD6BCBE0DFE30131993868A86D17958E.description: Develop specific criteria as individuals or in groups to assess and critique works of art.

FD6B24D0DFE30131993668A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe ways in which their culture is being reflected in current works of art.

FD6ADAB0DFE30131993568A86D17958E.description: Construct and describe plausible interpretations of what they perceive in works of art.

FD6A3630DFE30131993368A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works in the Visual Arts

FD69F0E0DFE30131993268A86D17958E.description: Compare, in oral or written form, representative images or designs from at least two selected cultures.

FD695B50DFE30131993068A86D17958E.description: View selected works of art from a culture and describe how they have changed or not changed in theme and content over a period of time.

FD68EA20DFE30131992F68A86D17958E.description: Research and discuss the role of the visual arts in selected periods of history, using a variety of resources (both print and electronic).

FD689650DFE30131992E68A86D17958E.description: Role and Development of the Visual Arts

FD685250DFE30131992D68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of the Visual Arts

FD680EC0DFE30131992C68A86D17958E.description: Use technology to create original works of art.

FD67CA30DFE30131992B68A86D17958E.description: Select specific media and processes to express moods, feelings, themes, or ideas.

FD678300DFE30131992A68A86D17958E.description: Create increasingly complex original works of art reflecting personal choices and in-creased technical skill.

FD673460DFE30131992968A86D17958E.description: Communication and Expression Through Original Works of Art

FD66E020DFE30131992868A86D17958E.description: Create a drawing, using varying tints, shades, and intensities.

FD669B90DFE30131992768A86D17958E.description: Apply the rules of two-point perspective in creating a thematic work of art.

FD6655C0DFE30131992668A86D17958E.description: Use various observational drawing skills to depict a variety of subject matter.

FD65BB40DFE30131992468A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in the Visual Arts

FD656C20DFE30131992368A86D17958E.description: Describe how artists can show the same theme by using different media and styles.

FD6508A0DFE30131992268A86D17958E.description: Discuss works of art as to theme, genre, style, idea, and differences in media.

FD64BAF0DFE30131992168A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe all the elements of art found in selected works of art (e.g., color, shape/form, line, texture, space, value).

FD646FD0DFE30131992068A86D17958E.description: Develop Visual Arts Knowledge and Vocabulary

FD641D80DFE30131991F68A86D17958E.description: Describe how balance is effectively used in a work of art (e.g., symmetrical, asymmetri-cal, radial).

FD63CB20DFE30131991E68A86D17958E.description: Analyze Art Elements and Principles of Design

FD636900DFE30131991D68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to the Visual Arts

FD62BC70DFE30131991B68A86D17958E.description: Research career opportunities in media, advertising, marketing, and interactive Web design.

FD623390DFE30131991968A86D17958E.description: Use theatrical skills to communicate concepts or ideas from other curriculum areas, such as a demonstration in history–social science of how persuasion and propaganda are used in advertising.

FD619AA0DFE30131991768A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Theatre, Film/Video, and Electronic Media to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD614690DFE30131991668A86D17958E.description: Identify examples of how theatre, television, and film can influence or be influenced by politics and culture.

FD60FD30DFE30131991568A86D17958E.description: Derivation of Meaning from Works of Theatre

FD60B5B0DFE30131991468A86D17958E.description: Develop and apply appropriate criteria for evaluating sets, lighting, costumes, makeup, and props.

FD602320DFE30131991268A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Critiquing Theatrical Experiences

FD5FD6E0DFE30131991168A86D17958E.description: Differentiate the theatrical traditions of cultures throughout the world, such as those in Ancient Greece, Egypt, China, and West Africa.

FD5F2C30DFE30131990F68A86D17958E.description: Create scripts that reflect particular historical periods or cultures.

FD5ED790DFE30131990E68A86D17958E.description: Role and Cultural Significance of Theatre

FD5E76B0DFE30131990D68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Theatre

FD5E2C90DFE30131990C68A86D17958E.description: Write and perform scenes or one-act plays that include monologue, dialogue, action, and setting together with a range of character types.

FD5DDBC0DFE30131990B68A86D17958E.description: Use effective vocal expression, gesture, facial expression, and timing to create character.

FD5D2600DFE30131990968A86D17958E.description: Participate in improvisational activities, demonstrating an understanding of text, subtext, and context.

FD5C97F0DFE30131990768A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Theatre

FD5C4900DFE30131990668A86D17958E.description: Identify how production values can manipulate mood to persuade and disseminate propaganda.

FD5BF1F0DFE30131990568A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of the Elements of Theatre

FD5BA8A0DFE30131990468A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of theatre, such as action/reaction, vocal projection, subtext, theme, mood, design, production values, and stage crew, to describe theatrical experiences.

FD5B5E70DFE30131990368A86D17958E.description: Development of the Vocabulary of Theatre

FD5B1350DFE30131990268A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Theatre

FD59C5B0DFE3013198FE68A86D17958E.description: Describe how knowledge of music connects to learning in other subject areas.

FD5920C0DFE3013198FC68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Music to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD58D2D0DFE3013198FB68A86D17958E.description: Develop criteria for evaluating the quality and effectiveness of musical performances and compositions, including arrangements and improvisations, and apply the criteria in personal listening and performing.

FD583270DFE3013198F968A86D17958E.description: Identify aesthetic qualities in a specific musical work.

FD57C430DFE3013198F868A86D17958E.description: Explain how various aesthetic qualities convey images, feeling, or emotion.

FD571BF0DFE3013198F668A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Music

FD56CA60DFE3013198F568A86D17958E.description: Listen to and describe the role of music in ancient civilizations (e.g., Chinese, Egyptian, Greek, Indian, Roman).

FD5683E0DFE3013198F468A86D17958E.description: Compare music from two or more cultures of the world as to the functions the music serves and the roles of musicians.

FD55F0B0DFE3013198F268A86D17958E.description: Classify by style and genre a number of exemplary musical works and explain the characteristics that make each work exemplary.

FD55A810DFE3013198F168A86D17958E.description: Listen to, describe, and perform music of various styles from a variety of cultures.

FD555AA0DFE3013198F068A86D17958E.description: Describe distinguishing characteristics of representative musical genres and styles from two or more cultures.

FD54A7D0DFE3013198EE68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Music

FD540810DFE3013198EC68A86D17958E.description: Arrange simple pieces for voices or instruments, using traditional sources of sound.

FD53BD60DFE3013198EB68A86D17958E.description: Compose short pieces in duple and triple meters.

FD531C10DFE3013198E968A86D17958E.description: Perform on an instrument a repertoire of instrumental literature representing various genres, styles, and cultures with expression, technical accuracy, tone quality, and articu-lation, by oneself and in ensembles (level of difficulty: 1 on a scale of 1–6).

FD52D280DFE3013198E868A86D17958E.description: Sing music written in two parts.

FD5283B0DFE3013198E768A86D17958E.description: Sing a repertoire of vocal literature representing various genres, styles, and cultures with expression, technical accuracy, good posture, tone quality, and vowel shape—written and memorized, by oneself and in ensembles (level of difficulty: 1 on a scale of 1–6).

FD51E560DFE3013198E568A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Music

FD5195E0DFE3013198E468A86D17958E.description: Describe larger music forms (sonata-allegro form, concerto, theme and variations).

FD514450DFE3013198E368A86D17958E.description: Analyze and compare the use of musical elements representing various genres and cultures, emphasizing meter and rhythm.

FD50FD00DFE3013198E268A86D17958E.description: Listen to, Analyze, and Describe Music

FD50B5F0DFE3013198E168A86D17958E.description: Sight-read simple melodies in the treble clef or bass clef.

FD506FE0DFE3013198E068A86D17958E.description: Transcribe simple aural examples into rhythmic notation.

FD5028A0DFE3013198DF68A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform rhythmic and melodic notation, using standard symbols for pitch, meter, rhythm, dynamics, and tempo in duple and triple meters.

FD4FD4D0DFE3013198DE68A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform intervals and triads.

FD4F1ED0DFE3013198DC68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Music

FD4E8A30DFE3013198DA68A86D17958E.description: Identify careers in dance and dance-related fields (e.g., teacher, therapist, videographer, dance critic, choreographer, notator).

FD4E3B50DFE3013198D968A86D17958E.description: Development of Life Skills and Career Competencies

FD4DECB0DFE3013198D868A86D17958E.description: Describe the responsibilities a dancer has in maintaining health-related habits (e.g., balanced nutrition, regular exercise, adequate sleep).

FD4D9290DFE3013198D768A86D17958E.description: Describe how other arts disciplines are integrated into dance performances (e.g., music, lighting, set design).

FD4CF480DFE3013198D568A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Dance to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FD4C9080DFE3013198D468A86D17958E.description: Distinguish the differences between viewing live and recorded dance performances.

FD4C23D0DFE3013198D368A86D17958E.description: Discuss the experience of performing personal work for others.

FD4B88C0DFE3013198D168A86D17958E.description: Propose ways to revise choreography according to established assessment criteria.

FD4B4460DFE3013198D068A86D17958E.description: Apply knowledge of the elements of dance and the craft of choreography to critiquing (spatial design, variety, contrast, clear structure).

FD4AFF70DFE3013198CF68A86D17958E.description: Description, Analysis, and Criticism of Dance

FD4AB680DFE3013198CE68A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Dance

FD4A4CA0DFE3013198CD68A86D17958E.description: Explain the various ways people have experienced dance in their daily lives (e.g., Roman entertainments, Asian religious ceremonies, baby naming in Ghana, Latin American celebrations).

FD49A740DFE3013198CB68A86D17958E.description: Explain the importance and function of dance in students' lives.

FD491D70DFE3013198C968A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast features of dances already performed from different countries.

FD488670DFE3013198C768A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Dance

FD482FB0DFE3013198C668A86D17958E.description: Revise, memorize, and rehearse dance studies for the purpose of performing for others.

FD47DD80DFE3013198C568A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate an awareness of the body as an instrument of expression when rehearsing and performing.

FD4786E0DFE3013198C468A86D17958E.description: Communication of Meaning in Dance Through Dance Performance

FD473750DFE3013198C368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate an ability to cooperate and collaborate with a wide range of partners and groups (e.g., imitating, leading/following, mirroring, calling/responding, echoing, sequence building).

FD46D160DFE3013198C268A86D17958E.description: Development of Partner and Group Skills

FD4656F0DFE3013198C168A86D17958E.description: Use the elements of dance to create short studies that demonstrate the development of ideas and thematic material.

FD4614D0DFE3013198C068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to coordinate movement with different musical rhythms and styles (e.g., ABA form, canon).

FD45D200DFE3013198BF68A86D17958E.description: Describe and incorporate dance forms in dance studies.

FD458F00DFE3013198BE68A86D17958E.description: Application of Choreographic Principles and Processes to Creating Dance

FD454BC0DFE3013198BD68A86D17958E.description: Compare and demonstrate the difference between imitating movement and creating original material.

FD450690DFE3013198BC68A86D17958E.description: Invent multiple possibilities to solve a given movement problem and develop the material into a short study.

FD446B60DFE3013198BA68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Dance

FD4424F0DFE3013198B968A86D17958E.description: Describe and analyze movements observed and performed, using appropriate dance vocabulary.

FD439750DFE3013198B768A86D17958E.description: Use the principles of contrast, unity, and variety in phrasing in dance studies and dances.

FD434AF0DFE3013198B668A86D17958E.description: Identify and use force/energy variations when executing gesture and locomotor and axial movements.

FD42F790DFE3013198B568A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Dance Elements

FD42A330DFE3013198B468A86D17958E.description: Incorporate a variety of force/energy qualities into executing a full range of movements.

FD4250C0DFE3013198B368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate focus, physical control, coordination, and accurate reproduction in perform-ing locomotor and axial movement.

FD420350DFE3013198B268A86D17958E.description: Development of Motor Skills and Technical Expertise

FD41B2F0DFE3013198B168A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception – Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Dance
